idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# 36 = Kick, 38 = Snare, 42 = Closed HiHat, 46 = Open HiHat, 49 = Crash Cymbal

def play_kick_beat():
    playNote(36, beats=1)
 # Play a kick drum note lasting 1 beat

def play_hihat_beat():
    for i in range(2):
        fastForward(1)   # Wait 2beats 
        playNote(38, beats=0.5)
  # Play closed hi-hat 4 times, 0.5 beat each
        
    
def play_complex_hihat():
    for i in range(4):
        playNote(42, beats=0.25)
        playNote(46, beats=0.25)
  # Alternates closed and open HiHat for variation

        if i % 2 == 0:    # Add kick every second beat
            playNote(36, beats=0.25)
        else: 
            playNote(38, beats=0.25) # Otherwise add snare
            
 #  fill_in (Ending)       
def play_fill_in():
    playNote(38, beats=0.5)
    playNote(38, beats=0.5)
    playNote(42, beats=0.25)
    playNote(42, beats=0.25)
    playNote(38, beats=0.25)
    playNote(49, beats=1.25)  
 # Ends with a crash after snare and hihat flurry

#  Crash 
def play_crash_intro():
    for i in range(2):   # Repeat six times
        playNote(49, beats=2) 
        fastForward(2)   # Wait 2beats 
    # Play a crash cymbal and wait for the reverb
    
def play_main_groove():  # Define a function named play_main_groove
    
    #This loop will be executed three, and i will increase from 0，1 and 2
    for i in range(3):    
        play_kick_beat()      # Play the Kick rhythm in each loop
        
        if i < 4:       # If i is less than 4 (that is, the 0th, 1st,2nd and 3rd times)
            play_hihat_beat()    # Play a regular HiHat
            
        else:          # Otherwise (i > = 4) only play the complex version
            play_complex_hihat()
            
      # Switch between simple and complex HiHat by round      
    # But above for i in range(3), i will actually only be 0, 1, 2
    
     #so else will never be executed
    
play_crash_intro()   # Play crash-based intro section
for i in range(1):
    play_main_groove()    # Repeat the main groove 2 times
    
play_fill_in()      # Ends the track with a fill-in

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# Define the full melody of 《the particles》 
# Part 1 and Part 2
def _melody_particles():
    Volume = 0.5 # Loudness
    velocity = 0.1# The force of note striking
for i in range(1):   #repeat the full melody 
    
# Part 1：Opening melody - part of main theme  
#Triplet notes
    playNote(72, beats=0.5)  # do 1st
    playNote(72, beats=0.5)  # do 2st 
    playNote(72, beats=0.5)  # do 3st

        # Four sixteenth notes
    playNote(79, beats=0.5)  # so 1st
    playNote(79, beats=0.5)  # so 2nd
    playNote(79, beats=0.5)  # so 3rd
    playNote(79, beats=0.5)  # so 4th
    playNote(79, beats=1)    # so - hold the note longer

        # More sixteenth notes
    playNote(79, beats=0.5)  # so
    playNote(79, beats=0.5)  # so
    playNote(79, beats=0.5)  # so
    playNote(79, beats=0.5)  # so
    playNote(79, beats=0.5)  # so
        
      # Rhythm: Eighth note followed by two sixteenth notes
    playNote(79, beats=0.7)  # so —— hold the note longer 
    playNote(78, beats=0.5)  # fa （F sharp）
    playNote(79, beats=1)    # so  （legato）- hold the note longer

    playNote(76, beats=0.5)  # mi
    playNote(75, beats=2)  # re (D sharp),(legato)- hold the note longer 
            
# one beat rest — ends the first phrase
            
# Part 2：Extended melody section - variation and echo 
    for _ in range(3):
            playNote(72, beats=0.5)  # do x3   #（Triplet notes）

    for _ in range(4):
            playNote(79, beats=0.5)  # so x4   # （Four sixteenth notes）
    playNote(79, beats=1)  # hold the last so

    playNote(83, beats=0.5)  # si
    playNote(82, beats=0.5)  # la

    for _ in range(4):
            playNote(79, beats=0.5)  # so x4 again
    playNote(79, beats=1)

    playNote(78, beats=0.5)  # fa （F sharp）
    playNote(76, beats=0.5)  # mi
    playNote(75, beats=1.2)  # re （D sharp）— slow finish

    playNote(68, beats=0.7)  #low so 
    playNote(76, beats=0.5)  # mi
    playNote(75, beats=1)  # re - hold the note longer 

#run the full melody    
_melody_particles()

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# Left hand melody 
# Note：60(C4), 64(E4), 62(D4), 55(G3), 67(G4), 66(F#4),63(D#4)

# Melody notes (left hand full phrase)
leftHandNotes = [60, 64, 62, 55, 60, 64, 62, 60, 60, 67, 66, 64, 64, 63]

# Beat length for each note
# Last two notes are longer 
leftHandBeats = [1.5, 1.5, 1.5, 1.5,  1.3, 1.3, 1.3, 1.3,  1.6, 1.6, 1.6, 1.6, 1.8, 1.8]

# Wait 1.5 seconds before playing
fastForward(1.8)

# ChorusNote（Simulates layered vocal-like sound）
def chorusNote(note, beats=2, count=2,volume=0.2,velocity= 0.3): 
# Left-hand duet and the voice is softer than that of the right hand


# Spread defines range of timing offset
    spread = 0.1 #The smaller the number, the more "uniform" the sound.
 # The larger the number, the more "natural and loose" the sound.
   
    for i in range(count):
        
# Offset:offset makes each note slightly delayed
       offset = max((random() - 0.2) * spread, 0)
    
# Random is a randomly generated decimal between 0 and 1

# But it fluctuates between -0.2 and +0.2. Indicates to start a little earlier or later

# Spread indicates reducing the float and finally offsetting the time by a decimal such as 0.00

# Max indicates to prevent negative numbers = start early

    fastForward(offset) 
# Enter a little offset value in advance

    playNote(note, beats - offset)  
# Play the notes, subtract the offset from the duration to avoid time overlap
    
    rewind(beats)  
# After playing, return to the starting point so that the next layer of chorus can be re-shifted and played from the same starting point

    fastForward(beats)  
# Move forward to the starting point of the next note

# Play one full melody round
def playMelodyOnce():
    for i in range(len(leftHandNotes)):
        chorusNote(leftHandNotes[i], leftHandBeats[i])  
   # Play 
playMelodyOnce()

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# Delay function to wait before entering drum section
def delay_for_intro(seconds):
    rest(seconds)

# Basic drum pattern unit
def play_double_drum_pattern():
    # Beat 2
    playNote(36, beats=0.5)  # Kick
    playNote(42, beats=0.5)  # Closed HiHat
    # Beat 2.5
    playNote(38, beats=0.5)  # Snare
    playNote(42, beats=0.5)  # Closed HiHat again
    
   # Beat 3.5
    rest(0.5)                # Dramatic pause
    # Beat 4
    playNote(48, beats=0.5)  # Open HiHat
    # Beat 4.5
    playNote(38, beats=0.5)  # Snare
    playNote(42, beats=0.5)  # Closed HiHat

# Play drums after a delay
def play_delayed_drums():
    delay_for_intro(8)  # delay of 8
    for i in range(4):  #repeat 4 times
        play_double_drum_pattern()

#play
play_delayed_drums()
